intro: Seseli libanotis var. kurilensis, commonly known as the Kuril Seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Kuril Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered umbels of white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique geographic distribution and ecological adaptations.
